qas.question: What group is opening a research center in Armenia?
As opposed to an industry-based economy, what industry is Armenia moving to?
The Arnmenian economy depends primarily on what?

answers.text: investment and support from Armenians abroad

qas.question: What did Armenias industry-based economy consist of?

answers.text: chemicals, electronics, machinery, processed food, synthetic rubber, and textile

context: The economy relies heavily on <a2_0>investment and support from Armenians abroad<a2_0/>. Before independence, Armenia's economy was largely industry-based – <a3_0>chemicals, electronics, machinery, processed food, synthetic rubber, and textile<a3_0/> – and highly dependent on outside resources. The republic had developed a modern industrial sector, supplying machine tools, textiles, and other manufactured goods to sister republics in exchange for raw materials and energy. Recently, the <a0_0>Intel Corporation<a0_0/> agreed to open a research center in Armenia, in addition to other technology companies, signalling the growth of the <a1_0>technology industry<a1_0/> in Armenia.
